title: create boots with the passive to walk through minions
body: I would buy it on every champ... :^) serious...

replies.body: It was actually an effect given to {{item:3047}}  on the pbe
WHEN!?

> [{quoted}](name=free05ct,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qTEjguOR,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2015-12-07T17:07:27.238+0000)
>
> WHEN!?

Right after they removed dodge chance.
So a time beyond human memory Then
The Land Before Time
*waits for someone to start posting songs*
if they gave it that passive, they would have to name it something like ninja tabi
When was this? if it was recent, was it reverted, or something we can look forward to? also, do you have a source for that?

> [{quoted}](name=Dar Raksada,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qTEjguOR,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-12-07T17:02:18.686+0000)
>
> It was actually an effect given to {{item:3047}}  on the pbe

Give it to boots of swiftness, they're already weak and only bought on tanks who need the unit walkiing anyway.
Boots of Swiftness definitely don't need a buff. They're way more useful than Boots of Mobility right now--the slow-resistance built in to them is super handy.
Wow you are a fucking genius. Hire him Riot.
haha thanks man bump for love
Or maybe just add ignoring unit collision to these -> {{item:3009}} ? I don't think it would make 'em overpowered, but maybe it would make these more attractive to buy?
That actually sounds pretty reasonable. Those boots a very rarely built anymore.

These are my personal favorite boot choice, but yeah, they are kind of unpopular in general. 
I would be okay with losing the slow reduction in exchange for ignoring unit collision.

Tbh, I was thinking of adding the ignoring unit collision passive on top of slow resist one. If {{item:3158}} could get Summoner spells CDR for exchange of only 5% of regular CDR, why not just add ignoring unit collision without removing slow resist?
And that also sounds like a good compensation.

No no no, the slow reduction is important. How else would our favorite catfish Tahm Kench be able to move around while eating you?

(Sarcasm)
Ah on a more serious note that slow reduction would be pretty good against Tahm's huge ass slow. =(
I always thought this would be a good way to make the captain enchantment better.

I think it'd be better to keep alacrity where is it, put shadow walk as the distortion boot enchant, and replace the captain enchant's effects with the current distortion's effects. no price changes. everything else I agree with.
But...but...but....Janna with Cpt Enchant, Talisman of Ascension, and Righteous Glory OP engage xD
seriously speaking, how often do you see a time where building captain boots is actually worth it? in my opinion it's almost always more valuable to get an elixir of iron and achieve the same effect.

It was a joke. I never said I disagree that captain enchant is popular and worth buying. However, now that you got me worked up (or is it my stress with finals? Eh, either way). Elixir of iron doesn't have the same effect. With captain enchant, you can flank and engage from behind the enemy and your team would still have the speed to catch up and join the fight (hopefully before you die but I didn't really notice any different honestly). It also free up the potion for another. Now that everyone gets homeguard, on tanks and engager (let's say like malphite, leona, or wukong), you don't really need the other enchants. 

Don't get me wrong, I'm not saying that captain enchant gives so much move speed that it's worth buying. I'm saying that I'm looking for a reason to procrastinate this final paper which is due by midnight tonight.

I think malphite and Wukong I could make a decent case for furor being better, honestly. and I knew you weren't disagreeing with me, was just wondering if you could think of a case where captain boots are worth getting. also, upvoted just because can.

The whole purpose of captain enchant is if your team doesn't have a good gap-closer to join the fight after you engage. Although I haven't used it enough (except for on janna when I'm ahead for the LoL) to see its full effect. Furor, on the other hand, is a self-buff kinda thing. So you can keep up with the enemy (or kite away). 

Now that Homeguard's free, we'll see a lot more of the other enchants. Who knows, maybe people will get captain more. Ask me that in half a year and i'll tell you xD. (PS 1 hour and 47 minutes until this thing's due....)
activate procrastination mode.
Oh, boy. It was shifted into maximum overdrive weeks ago xD
Why can't I exalt posts?!
I like that idea it's really well thought through.
I think they should just make that a passive on the Alacrity enchant.    + 20 Move speed and move through units or something like that.

Dear Riot,

http://33.media.tumblr.com/eea37a5d8b008ee55de322ee00a4add8/tumblr_npbcw2Rhgf1r1juiro1_500.gif

Sincerely, Melee mains and everyone else who have been minion blocked to death.

I fucking hate the creepblock since the preseason started.

But the entire point of boots is for there to be a decision. Not an obvious best choice every single time for every single melee champion.
I had a thought on adding this to Galio's E along its path for your whole team, largely to help get galio into the spotlight again.
or give it to {{item:3117}}

I like the boot options that we have now. If they make another set of boots, it becomes a choice to get a ghost ability to just get around bad minion mechanics vs getting actual helpful stats such as damage reduction, cdr, magic pen, tenacity, or attack speed.
I think they should fix the minions instead of making some band-aid boots. Or make the passive an enchantment.
If i remember correctly, they are going to revert minion blocking to the preseason state.

I agree. The uniqueness of being able to move through units is very noticeable right now, with the bad minion crowding, but once that is all fixed up it should be a matter of skill to get around minions.
That said, while the minions are being fixed maybe they should give everyone the ability to walk through units. ^^
Just put the passive on all level 2 boots? Or even level 1.

Or maybe just remove creep block. Not like it really does anything important for the game. Nobody enjoys when an enemy is stopped by creeps, and nobody enjoys being stopped by creeps. Only 4 champions have persistent unit collision preventing pieces in their kit, one is being removed, and Repertoir (I think, might have been someone else) even said he wouldn't mind others going as well. So what's the deal? Why does it exist? If it's annoying, nobody likes it, and doesn't provide any way to avoid it, then it should just be removed.
It exists to stop large-hitbox champions like Hecarim or Nautilus from physically standing over their minions to prevent the enemy from CSing.
Or an enchantment

{{champion:40}} {{champion:38}}  Why would anyone need this?

Seriously, though, I can see it being useful & powerful.  Maybe as a boot enchantment?  It's more logical there than on something like phantom dancer.
Doesn't {{item:3046}} still give that ability?

> [{quoted}](name=CitadelOfIce,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qTEjguOR,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-12-07T17:20:23.533+0000)
>
> Doesn't {{item:3046}} still give that ability?

Not boots.

Seems like a band-aid fix to a bigger problem with the game right now.

I'm not saying don't do it, but having to spend your gold to avoid getting stuck on minions seems really like avoiding the bigger overall issue.
NO MORE MINION BLOCK! #SayNO2MinionBlock
an enchantment would kill it *_*
and in season 7 it will be on every boots from 20 min mark.
